controls.title: Ensure audit log storage size is configured
controls.description: Configure the maximum size of the audit log file. Once the log reaches the maximum size, it will be rotated and a new log file will be started.
controls.rationale: It is important that an appropriate size is determined for log files so that they do not impact the system and audit data is not lost.
controls.audit:
Run the following command and verify output is in compliance with site policy:
# grep max_log_file /etc/audit/auditd.conf
max_log_file = <MB>
controls.remediation:
Set the following parameter in /etc/audit/auditd.conf in accordance with site policy:
max_log_file = <MB>
controls.references: 1. See the auditd.conf(5) man page for more information.
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 8.3 Ensure Adequate Audit Log Storage
v7: 6.4 Ensure adequate storage for logs

controls.title: Ensure audit logs are not automatically deleted
controls.description: The max_log_file_action setting determines how to handle the audit log file reaching the max file size. A value of keep_logs will rotate the logs but never delete old logs.
controls.rationale: In high security contexts, the benefits of maintaining a long audit history exceed the cost of storing the audit history.
controls.audit:
Run the following command and verify output matches:
# grep max_log_file_action /etc/audit/auditd.conf
max_log_file_action = keep_logs
controls.remediation:
Set the following parameter in /etc/audit/auditd.conf:
max_log_file_action = keep_logs
controls.references: 1. See the auditd.conf(5) man page for more information.

v8: 8.3 Ensure Adequate Audit Log Storage
v7: 6.4 Ensure adequate storage for logs

controls.title: Ensure system is disabled when audit logs are full
controls.description: The auditd daemon can be configured to halt the system when the audit logs are full.
controls.rationale: In high security contexts, the risk of detecting unauthorized access or nonrepudiation exceeds the benefit of the system's availability.
controls.audit:
Run the following commands and verify output matches:
# grep space_left_action /etc/audit/auditd.conf
space_left_action = email
# grep action_mail_acct /etc/audit/auditd.conf
action_mail_acct = root
# grep admin_space_left_action /etc/audit/auditd.conf
admin_space_left_action = halt
controls.remediation:
Set the following parameters in /etc/audit/auditd.conf:
space_left_action = email
action_mail_acct = root
admin_space_left_action = halt
controls.impact: If the system is configured to halt when the audit logs are full, the system will be unavailable until the logs are rotated or deleted.
controls.references: 1. See the auditd.conf(5) man page for more information.
